snippet: The advertising campaign is timed to coincide with the first town hall-style meeting that Mayor Bill de Blasio has held since being elected.
abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration announces it will spend $1 million to publicize recent, and unprecedented, rent freeze for rent-regulated tenants in city; ad campaign will coincide with timing of de Blasio's first town hall-style meeting since being elected mayor.
lead_paragraph: The advertising campaign is timed to coincide with the first town hall-style meeting that Mayor Bill de Blasio has held since being elected.

headline.main: City to Spend $1 Million on Ads Promoting Rent Freeze on Stabilized Units
headline.print_headline: City to Buy $1 Million in Ads Promoting Freeze on Regulated Rents
